subject: Self Care
title: The Sunlight Habit
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Sunlight Habit.

hook.text: Ten minutes of morning sunlight sets your circadian clock, boosts mood, and improves sleep 14 hours later.

buildup.text: Morning light signals the brain to suppress melatonin and start the daytime alertness cycle properly.

discovery.text: Sunlight exposure increases serotonin production. Low serotonin is linked to depression and poor sleep.

twist.text: Indoor light is too dim to trigger these effects. Even a cloudy sky outdoors is ten times brighter.

climax.text: Step outside within an hour of waking. No sunglasses needed. Let natural light enter through your eyes.

punchline.text: Morning sunlight is free medicine. Step outside daily.

quiz.question: Why is morning sunlight important for health?
options: It sets the circadian clock, boosts serotonin, and improves sleep
Indoor lights work just as well
